results.title: Metformin reduces androgen receptor and upregulates homeobox A10 expression in uterine endometrium in women with polycystic ovary syndrome
results.text_hl: However, the mechanism by which @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ improves @<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014591 @@@endometrial abnormality@@@ remains unknown.

results.title: Clinical and metabolic characteristics of endometrial lesions in polycystic ovary syndrome at reproductive age
results.text_hl: Oral contraceptives, progestogen and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ are recommended for prevention and treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014591 @@@endometrial lesions@@@ in @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

results.title: Ameliorative Effects of Quercetin and Metformin and Their Combination Against Experimental Endometriosis in Rats.
results.text_hl: This study was conducted to evaluate the effect of @CHEMICAL_Quercetin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011794 @@@quercetin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, alone or in combination, on the ectopic and eutopic @<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014591 @@@endometrial@@@ tissues in a @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ model of @DISEASE_Endometriosis @DISEASE_MESH:D004715 @@@endometriosis@@@.

results.text_hl: Our observations suggested that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment might be helpful for management of age-associated @<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014591 @@@uterine dysfunctions@@@.

results.title: Effect of metformin on the endometrial proteome of diet-induced obese mice.
results.text_hl: There is evidence that the endometrial function is altered in @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obese@@@ and/or @DISEASE_Insulin_Resistance @DISEASE_MESH:D007333 @@@insulin@@@ resistant @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@, an insulin-sensitizing drug, has shown potential in treating @DISEASE_Reproductive_Tract_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D060737 @@@metabolic and reproductive disorders@@@, including @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@polycystic ovary syndrome@@@ (@DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@) and may enhance fertility outcomes by improving @<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014591 @@@endometrial dysfunction@@@.

results.title: Endometrial function in women with polycystic ovary syndrome: a comprehensive review.
results.text_hl: Although currently no intervention can be universally recommended to reverse @<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014591 @@@endometrial dysfunction@@@ in @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@, lifestyle modifications and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ may improve underlying @<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014591 @@@endometrial dysfunction@@@ and pregnancy outcomes in @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obese@@@ and/or @DISEASE_Insulin_Resistance @DISEASE_MESH:D007333 @@@insulin resistant@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

results.title: Antiproliferative effect of metformin on the endometrium--a clinical trial.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: We conclude that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ could be used as an effective antiestrogenic agent in control of @DISEASE_Abnormalities_Drug_Induced @DISEASE_MESH:D000014 @@@abnormal@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014591 @@@endometrial proliferative disorders@@@.
